title: Ezreal Support - How much higher a standard should players who pick "off-meta" champions be held to?
body:
Hey Everyone! 

I've been playing Ezreal support a bit towards the end of season 8 and recently received a two week suspension:
https://imgur.com/a/1DkaTWq
[Game 1](https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2897760841/78752420)
[Game 2](https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2914661059/78752420)
[Game 1 Story Link here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/A5AE4R4N-the-key-to-instilling-your-teammates-with-hope-and-the-will-not-to-give-up?comment=0000)

I've received many comments in other threads about this pick/case already and I'm interested to learn more about what other people think.

Here's a short list of questions that I'd like to see how people answer and discuss with everyone:

* **Should off-meta champ players be held to a higher standard than players who play meta champions? If so, how so & how much higher?**
* **How would you feel about an Ezreal support in your game?**
* **Does your opinion of how you feel about an Ezreal support change at all if it's a low-elo(bronze/silver) game?**
* **When playing an off-meta champ like Ezreal Support should you discuss your champion choice with your team before picking it?**
* **What are the best safe guards I can put in place to main Ezreal support so I don't receive chat restrictions, suspensions or bans?**


**My Story:**
I got the idea from someone who I played with when I was filled to ADC one game sometime in the middle of Season 8.

It's also worth noting they did a rework on Ezreal which went out live on October 23rd. [cited link](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/champion-update/ezreal-coming-soon)

**Why Ezreal?**
The main reason is because it's a champ I enjoy playing and I've tried him as an ADC and I don't enjoy playing him nearly as much or that role as much.  I like the fast traveling skill shot q which can be spammed and used to poke down/get gold from enemy champions.  I like that I can hit a meaningful mid game power spike that offers(pick potential, peel & damage) between 20:00-25:00 minutes in majority of my games independent of getting kills,assists or farm. 

The official reasoning was "Intentionally Feeding".  Here's an excerpt of the response I got from the robot initially when I submitted a support ticket:

> ...You’re receiving this penalty due to evidence found of intentional feeding, or “inting” as the human children say. It is, to borrow a human phrase, a “not cool,” and may result in a permaban the next time it occurs.

Obviously, one of the games cited I had 0 deaths so I requested a human to get more information.  Eventually they responded with:

> ...Your account has been suspended for 2-weeks for hurting the competitive integrity of your teammate's matches, not for intentionally feeding. Specifically for taking roles that were not assigned to you. Please excuse our incorrect phrasing in your reform card.

Being that I queue for support in about 80% on my league games I find it particularly strange.  Why would I try to steal someone's role when I have the role I want to be playing in the current game?  Anyway, I added some of these comments to the tickets along with a few others and the last response from them looks like this:

> ...I get how confusing this is since you're testing out something that's not conventional and doing well. The problem is it's a team game. You have to be able to communicate your strategy to your team and work with them to win the game. Sadly it seems that there was a lack of communication of your role int he team and it's come back to bite you.
> 
> After reviewing your games with my team, we won't be lifting this suspension. Let me know if you need anything else!

So, it's very clear to me that this suspension will not be lifted.  I find this response especially demoralizing for the entire "off-meta" community.


[edit]Adding some context to the games:
Game #1: Jinx backed around 4 minutes and went top lane and wasn't seen again in bot lane for all of laning phase.  I tried my best in a 1v2 lane and I feel like I was a major contributing factor to us winning this game.

Game #2: Our lane was heavily camped although I did not die.  I spent a great deal of the last 10-15 minutes of the game clearing super minion waves that would have otherwise hit/killed our nexus towers which is why my CS is "high".

[edit #2]
Here's a challenger commentary playing Ezreal support in preseason last season:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JcBx0MOWz-E

Warding tri can warn you of potential dives for example, allowing you to back off of turret.  After landing phase, good vision can straight up win a game.

But, when you're in a 1v2 lane when you can accumulate cs you're often handicapping yourself(thus your team) by upgrading your support item especially if it's too early.

This is one of only a very few cases where there is, in fact, an absolute. The support item is super gold-efficient, gives vision, and frees up your trinket to get vision  CONTROL, while also generating additional gold for you. Skipping that is just bad.

Without vision, how can your team tell where certain enemies can be located so that you could've safely split-push somewhere? Your team could've also got caught out multiple times due to the lack of vision, or enemy wards that weren't cleared off at all since you didn't changed your trinket to the Sweeping Lens.

No matter how bad games tend to be, vision is always one of the most important team component to winning games. There's no need to be so stingy about spending a simple 450 gold.

By sinking 450 gold earlier into Frostfang in this specific game(especially as a rushed item) definitely IMO would have increased our chances to lose.

I needed to deal damage in fights to help us have a chance at winning what was essentially a 4v5.  It doesn't mean I don't value vision, I have a trinket that I used effectively throughout the game.  I have the highest wards placed score in the game.  I also bought the frost fang upgrade to get us vision during our Baron push.

Again, you're listing misconceptions of Bronze elo regarding Warding. In higher elo, warding does a lot more jobs than simply picking stuff to do more damage. You could be safely split-pushing while knowing the enemy team is somewhere else, you could've managed to pick an enemy off who was sighted from afar, you could've saved your team from face-checking bushes to their deaths. Aside from that, you can just change to your red lens trinket & contribute your team even more by eliminating the enemy team's vision power. Not every cases can be solved with just damage. 

I'm saying that even though that last minute sell would've been a "last resort", that kind of outcome could've changed a lot if you upgraded your Support item a lot earlier, even if the outcome changes just a little. 

Tbh, if you're really keen into picking a damaging Support, I suggest Brand over Ezreal. At least he does meaningful DoT AoE damage & slows/stuns, both something of which Ezreal doesn't have.

Looking at [Game 1](https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2897760841/78752420?tab=stats&participant=5):

Let's hypothetically swap Brand which is your suggested pick in for Ezreal.

Jinx decided to leave you in a 1v2 lane less than 4 minutes into the game, I have some questions as to how to proceed:
How do you farm or even stand in exp range vs a Thresh/Twitch?
Would you take creeps from the lane that would otherwise die to your tower or their creeps?
Would you use your spells to try and get creeps or poke the enemies?
If you did use spells at any point, how do you handle tower dives if you're out of mana?
Let's say you were able to get some farm somehow in this lane, would you build ap damage?

> 1) This isn't a high elo game.

Hang on....

> 2) If you could watch this video for about 70 seconds at around the 18:15 minute mark:
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JcBx0MOWz-E
> 
> Maybe a high elo player saying similar things will help out more.

So it's not a high elo game, yet you're still taking tips from a Challenger player while still being in the wrong elo? Second, how old is that video? We're talking about a simple 450 gold investment, not 800. Third, not all situations will turn out to be like the one in the video, who apparently has 2 tanks in his team, unlike your team in Game 1. There WILL be times where one of you will get caught out due to the lack of warding clearing/placements, and that one small simple mistake will cost your game.
 
> This really isn't the issue.  I feel very adamantly that majority of my buys and corresponding timings had good reasons and rationals.  If you disagree with me & you want to report me, should I be punished for this?

I'm really not saying as to whether if you build off-meta and you deserved the ban or not. All I'm saying is that one simple Support item is seriously crucial to your team's goal in winning games. I honestly don't really care w/e the hell you're building as long as you have that one simple upgraded Support item with you.



> How do you farm or even stand in exp range vs a Thresh/Twitch?

You have multiple ranged abilities to farm with, assuming you took Manaflow Band with you or at least purchased Lost Chapter. And Thresh's Q is still blockable by minions & will most likely forced to Flash+E for the kill. Even if either of them come near you, you can punish them back with W/E+Q. Literally none of them has dashes/blinks to dodge it.

> Would you take creeps from the lane that would otherwise die to your tower or their creeps?

> * **What are the best safe guards I can put in place to main Ezreal support so I don&#039;t receive chat restrictions, suspensions or bans?**

Start champ select saying that you want to play an unconventional support. Let them know that you will not take CS and will be heavily focused on poking and turret damaging. 

Let ban phase go through but only hover your pick after all your team mates have banned. Once that has happened, hover Ezreal.

They will freak out again, and now you mention about your strong points for Ezreal, like the poke speed, the W turret dmg, and the E out to face tank CC

Reassure them that you won't take CS and ask them to trust you. 



If they don't agree to it, then you might want to reconsider your pick. 

Point is that you are talking and discussing with your team, and not shoving your strategy down their throat. 

In game, make sure you pay attention to the map and ward often, as you dont have any CC, so they will blame you for any death if they get ganked.

Communicate the enemy jg position and tell them to position safer if the enemy jg is around. Trade aggressively and make sure you aren't just sitting behind your bot laner throwing out Qs. Also, don't just run away if they eat a bad hook, make sure you attempt to zone the enemy out as well. 

If you want people to have more confidence in you, then you need to play at a higher level than they are in order to prove yourself to them.
